alert.note: Alert for Allegan; Mason; Muskegon; Oceana; Ottawa; Van Buren (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 26 at 3:42PM EDT until August 26 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...High wave action, strong currents, and dangerous swimming conditions expected. Piers may be heavily swamped by waves. * WHERE...Mason, Oceana, Muskegon, Ottawa, Allegan and Van Buren counties. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Strong currents can pull swimmers into deeper water and high waves can sweep people off piers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds will increase to around 20 mph late this afternoon. Waves will build and peak in the late afternoon and evening in the 2 to 5 foot range. Given winds will be from the north, the most dangerous places to swim today will be on the incoming waves side of piers. The incoming wave side will be on the north side of north piers.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions and do not venture out on piers. Please check with your local authorities on potential beach closures.

area.areaDesc: Allegan; Mason; Muskegon; Oceana; Ottawa; Van Buren
